column4: Ubuntu was updating like 150 packages and it seems frozen on configuring cupsys
Thge details shows * Starting common unix printring sytsem: cupsd
What do I do?
What do I do if an update freezes?
Anyone?
What do I do if an update freezes?
ctrl+c if in cli, kill the app otherwise and redo the update process
its frozen on Starting common unix printing system: cupsd
that's not an update, that's starting a service
Its during "Configuring cupsys"
if that's PART of an update... theeeenn.... all i can say is kill the update, and restart cupsd yourself
something in your config is probably holding it up
I dont know how to kill the update ctrl+c does nothing
use ps to find the pid, and use kill <pid> to destroy the application
I can't open a terminal
press ALT+F2
otherwise if THAT won't come up, seem slike your OS is frozen, try to restart X with CTRL+ALT+BKSPC
My OS isn't frozen
sorry, mean to say WM
like I can bring up the power management applet
and the text editor
ok... odd... try ALT+CTRL+F1 to drop to a TTY, log in as your user, and sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart
